Very odd check in procedure requiring a sign off with penalty for an early departure, all the while a photo of Wyatt Earp was watching us at the front desk. Lobby area was constantly cold and not welcoming. Umpteen chairs and couches positioned everywhere, but none are inviting for casual conversation or meetings. There is a restaurant but we never saw it open. There is not a quick coffee shop or gift shop in the hotel to even purchase water or misc. items. The overwhelming mustiness and odor present in the sleeping rooms was a real problem. It never went away. The beds were extremely comfortable (one of the few highlights). There was no real comfortable reading chair in the rooms. They were all antiques which were not meant to sit on. The rooms were clean but not inviting. The windows had old fashioned pull down windowshades which were very difficult at times to close. They needed to be closed because of the neighbor's balcony which looked right into the room. The elevator experience is one which we will never forget. It's hard to put into words what we saw. We are still trying to figure out the reason for the strange "puppet vignette" which was viewed from the elevator. The first time you see it, you can't believe your eyes. It is so odd. Almost as odd as the life size paper mache horse in the lobby?! Throughout our entire stay, we experienced a strange cast of characters at the front desk each and every day. The oddest one was the person dressed in a black hooded sweatshirt that was pulled up and tied around his face. We thought it was the grim reaper! Could be frightening for small children. We did not have the option of checking out since our reservation was made by a sponsoring company. So we made sure to stay out about town for as long as possible after work in order to avoid the musty smells and strangeness of the place. Alcohol also helped the situation.

Reviews.Title: “A step back in time, cozy, relaxing & fun-Great value.”
Reviews.Author: DarrinandAmber
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in February - was intrigued by the history of the hotel. I will say I was impressed and very pleased staying there in fact I bookrd another weekend a few weeks later. The location was great--Its not in the heart of the craziness of the gas lamp quarter but more towards the end kind of off the beaten path. Parking isn't great - but I managed to be ok both weekends I stayed there, it was metered and across the street from the hotel - but the meters were free on the weekends. The room I was in both times had a fireplace so it was very cozy. I would highly recommend for value & history - an overall great experience! Magdaleno's

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: kenjigal
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for $99 for 3 nights through Wyndham by agreeing to go to a timeshare presentation. However, there were an addition $94 in taxes and fees so the deal ended up not being all that great. The hotel was very clean but very victorian. It way too much for my taste, keeping in mind that I love modern and contemporary. My mother, on the other hand, didn't mind the victorian decor - it's fine for the older generations. The doll display seen through the glass elevator on the third floor really creeped me out. The staff are absolutely fabulous and willing to help with any requests. They were very knowledgeable about things to do in the area and driving directions. There are fireplaces in every room and they are all intricately decorated, with wallpaper border and a decorative paint job in the bathroom. Everything worked fine except toward the end of our stay it took a few flushes to get the toliet to flush. Complimentary breakfast (6 to 9am) consisted of just okay muffins and pastries, get to breakfast early to get the good stuff. There was also coffee everyday - and juice too on Sunday. The best part was the location - in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter. There are tons of restaurants and shops within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: tallmom31
Reviews.Content: If one selects a hotel based on the internet, consider this hotel as being nothing like the internet. Lovely place to wander through and admire decor but cold, unfriendly place to stay. There isn't a restaurant,no room service(altho an order form was in the room) but shampoo and soap weren't. It never warmed up in the room at all during the stay. The noise level in the Gaslamp area was terrible in my room and I was told it was the quieter room. The internet says microwave,refrigerator, coffee...but clerk said only in suites....coffee, rolls in lobby each morning cold, and lobby too cold to enjoy them ...juice nice and cold tho. This was for a vacation membership presentation...didn't buy it. Perhaps this hotel in summer would be more appealing, but I won't try it...

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: West-Coast-Fan
Reviews.Content: The Horton Grand has potential but it clearly needs to be renovated. The location is good, within minutes walking distance of attractions, restaurants and shopping. My room was pretty well cared for and seemed clean enough but the entire property is dated. The dÃ©cor and furniture come off as an old tired themed hotel. The standard amenities you find in most hotels are missing â€“ no coffee maker in room, no full sized ironing board, you will pay extra for internet access. The shower head in the tub is way too low. The hotel smells old and musty. I didnâ€™t experience the poor customer service many reviews report. In fact all of the employees I spoke with were friendly and helpful. Although my experience was fairly neutral, my suggestion would be to look for something more modern. This property will not appeal to most travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to my (not so high) standards”
Reviews.Author: GISTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me and 7 co-workers for a conference in town. Used to staying at "standard" 2-star hotels for business travel, like Hyatt, Marriott, etc. I have to say that this hotel was unacceptable for me. The hotel had a stale, musty odor that was covered up with too much fragrance. The room was clean enough, but the dated furniture, ratty carpet and damp smell made me reconsider. After one of what was supposed to be five nights, I checked out. What's worse, I found a room at the Hard Rock hotel (five stars, amazing) that was only $50 more a night...definitely worth the change. All of the women in my group checked out and switched hotels, while the men were able to tough it out. Apparently the rooms in the "new" part of the building sounded a bit better than mine, which faced the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, outdated, but serviceable”
Reviews.Author: SWChickie
Reviews.Content: The high point of this hotel is the location - it's in easy walking distance of the heart of the Gas Lamp Quarter, but offset by a block or two so the noise is a little less. Great walking access to the convention center, the marina, and embarcadero park. The hotel itself is not ideal for business travelers- no free wireless, no coffee maker in the room, no counter space in the bathrooms. Check-in took about 30 minutes- ridiculous! It's clear that the hotel was really beautiful at some point- but now it's very tired, and the crazy mix of floral patterns everywhere was just one indication that no one is putting any thought into the overall look and feel of the hotel. The bathroom was not very clean, mostly because all the fixtures, wallpaper, etc, are so old, cracked, and dingy. The toiletries were cheap and from China. I did not use them. The hotel also gave off a somewhat creepy feel the first few nights when I arrived home late, weird staff barely acknowledged me, and the hallways and large sitting areas seemed to be echoing with ghosts from years past. As someone else mentioned, there are "scenes" that you can see from the elevator featuring dolls - one is a sewing room, one is an old-fashioned telephone operator - SUPER CREEPY and WEIRD. But I did feel much more comfortable when a more friendly nightclerk turned up and greeted me the last few nights. Overall the location was great and if you get an excellent deal and just need a place to crash- this will be fine. But if you're looking for somewhere to relax and recoup, or an efficient business traveler hotel, this is NOT it.

Reviews.Title: “The moldy hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalaNorthDakota
Reviews.Content: Mold and dust everywhere, disguised under Victorian atmosphere. Management doesn't understand what a alergy crises is and not willing to give a refund..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: StubbleJumper
Reviews.Content: I wanted a reasonably affordable hotel within walking distance of PETCO Park which limited my options. I had a choice between a Comfort Inn and the Horton. Neither hotel reviewed that well so I took a chance and booked at the Horton. I thought at the very least it would be an experience. I must admit that that I reluctantly booked my stay at the Horton Grand after reading the reviews posted on tripadvisor.com, but those fears were unwarranted. The hotel was clean, there was no noise and the A/C worked just fine. There are some things that a more discriminating traveler may find to be annoying like the shower being five and a half feet high, the slow elevators (its only a four story hotel so its not a big deal) and the check-in/check-out process is incredibly slow. There are some reviews about the front desk staff being the friendliest, and I too experienced that but after stopping to chat with night clerk a few times he wasnâ€™t so bad. If Iâ€™m back in San Diego again I would stay there if I was looking to go down to PETCO Park.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected! Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: jxb534
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Horton Grand for three nights and were very pleased with our stay. It is located in the best part of town within walking distance to dozens of GREAT restaurants and within a short bus ride to Sea World, the zoo, and other San Diego attractions. Ken at the front desk was very helpful and provided us with information on busses, trolleys, restaurants, tennis courts, directions, etc. He was very pleasant and helpful as were the other staff that we encountered during our stay there. Maid service was very nice. Our room was always clean with fresh linens and towels when we returned at night. The hotel is a little bit older but it has a lot of character and is in a great location. It doesn't have a pool or a gym so if that is something you are interested in you may want to look elsewhere for those ammenities. The hotel has a restaurant that serves only breakfast but with so many restaurants within a stone's throw we didn't mind that at all. Also, we had a beautiful balcony overlooking 4th street. Ken did warn us of some street noise at night but it didn't bother us. If you are a light sleeper though, you may want to ask for a quieter room. We loved seeing the bar crowd stumble home and be part of all the action from up above. The Horton Grand doesn't have fancy sinks, toilets, pools or gyms but it does have a lot of character, charm, and is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK!”
Reviews.Author: Travelor30317
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 bad nights for a convention. I am appalled that ASTD would put this dump on their preferred list of hotels. This place is very tired. The service in the restaurant for breakfast is horrible. I went to Starbucks up the street after waiting for 30 minutes for service. This place should be leveled and a new hotel built in its' place.

Reviews.Title: “A case of what could have been...”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Deezel
Reviews.Content: I'd like to start by saying that my stay at the Horton was fundamentally fine - the room was clean and comfortable (although the bed was a little soft for my taste) and the location is great. The staff were also friendly and efficient. However, I was left with the feeling that this historic propery could be so much more. The whole place is looking rather tired and in need of a complete refurb. I like hotels to have some character and history, but the Horton just feels a bit threadbare rather than historic. I would also question the value of having gas fires in each room in San Diego, especially considering the aircon in my room barely seemed to work at all. With a bit of investment, the Horton could be a fantastic Hotel. At present it's just OK.

Reviews.Title: “A Tired Historical Reno”
Reviews.Author: On_the_Fly_Traveller
Reviews.Content: When this historical hotel was renovated and refurbished in 1986 it was probably a striking standout. But that was 22 years ago, and now it is looking tired and dated. Antique furniture should not just mean old and original - scratched tops and drawers that do not close are less than one expects today. The cute historical displays seen from the elevator at each floor are stale and hard to see through the dirty windows. The much vaunted courtyard is sterile and mostly empty except for some little used garden furniture. The front lobby reception desk is worn. The staff are casually dressed in golf shirts and, although friendly, do not have a crisp appearance. All in all, this hotel looks like a place that the owners built and have either forgot about, or are not making enough money to keep it up to date. The location, however, is very good, with all the Gaslamp District restaurants an easy walk away. This is a good thing, because the hotel has no food service amenities. I stayed one night, then decided to move on to a more modern hotel. Not because of anything really bad, but simply because other hotels offered more.

Reviews.Title: “classic grand dame of hotels”
Reviews.Author: roya_7
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of the gaslamp district, this grande dame of hotels has been carefully restored and is a delightful place to stay. The staff could not have been more friendly and efficient and the hotel is a delight of courtyards and oak balustrades. The balcony rooms are a joy but are the only rooms with windows that open. For fresh air folk this is a decided minus in any hotel and one the hotel could well fix. You should expect a silent night - the hotel is in the heart of the Gaslamp District which stays awake until 2 a.m. You should also not expect great parking - you are in the heart of the city but you can expect shopping and restaurants and a waterfront walk right from the hotel doorstep, efficient and pleasant staff and courteous service. Rooms all have fake fireplaces and the city views from the 4th floor balconies are delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bexleo
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel whilst attending the Winter Fancy Food Show. I was dubious after reading all of the bad reviews on this website but I am glad that I did not listen. This hotel was fabulous, the staff were friendly and quirky, ok so they dont all dress in the same uniforms as they would at the hilton but how dull is that anyway. My room was beautiful and very clean and the maid was fabulous, with adding a very nice touch to my room, by laying out my dresses so they did not crease or just generally tidying up after me... This really was a gem in a good location and with fabulous rooms. I had no problem with noise, it is a naval town so on weekends the recruits do let their hair down and the pubs would be busy, but no issue of noise near the hotel. I am not sure what people expect when they book into this hotel, you can clearly see from the hotel website that its not a dull hilton or hyatt. I recommend this little hotel and lets face it some people are just very fussy, oh and we had no problem with valet parking at all..

Reviews.Title: “Stay Clear-especially of you have a car to park”
Reviews.Author: Nobles1
Reviews.Content: THis was the worst experience of my life. I have stayed at many hotels and also booked through hotwire before and this was the WORST experience EVER! After this night I will no longer EVER book through HOTWIRE and NEVER EVER stay at the Horton Grand Hotel. The evening started at 6:30 when we arrived to check in to the hotel and found that the Valet lot, the ONLY lot was FULL. Not only do the valet people not care, the hotel staff doesn't care and neither does HOTWIRE. Just to let all travelers know-hotwire and this hotel made it clear to me that they DO NOT have to guarantee you ANYWHERE to park your car. They only guarantee you a room to stay in. With this said we got a map of all downtown parking in the area and were told that you're on your own, and by the way, the lots close at 2am so after that your are just screwed and if you get towed oh well that's your problem. SO after wasting 2 hours to find parking about 10 blocks away I was pretty annoyed. They rooms are average-motel quality and the customer service stinks. I was telling my father about my experience and found out that he had a similar one there in October 2000, on his honeymoon night-no parking and they were told too bad it's your problem. The only thing good about the Horton Grand is it's location. Good location. The best part was packing my bags and leaving at 2am so my car didn't get towed. If there was a rating less than terrible that would be my score.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: MLElove
Reviews.Content: I came down to San Diego to visit my brother who's in the Navy stationed there, and our mom booked this hotel for us. The guy who works the front desk at night is the rudest, meanest, grumpiest person I have ever had to deal with. We spoke with the hotel manager about the problems he gave us, and he said he would take care of it. He also said he has had many complaints about this front desk worker. The next 2 nights, the guy (JOHN) was even ruder to us! It made my stay thee HORRIBLE and I will never recommend this hotel to ANYONE. No one deserves to be treated how we were. Customer Service and just plain being nice to the guests should be #1 priority at a ($200 + per night ) hotel. It gave me a stomache ache. Don't stay here, there are far to many amazing hotels in the Gaslamp district that treat their guests kindly!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Horton - Nothing Grand About It”
Reviews.Author: Mlogs
Reviews.Content: The Horton Grand Hotel, sits in the middle of a great area. Easy access to a whole host of different dining choices as well as bars and night clubs. Beyond its location the Horton lacks in a number of areas. The front desk, while friendly most of the time, can be slightly rude. One desk clerk made a comment to me about another guest, and while I agreed with his sentiments I thought it was more than a little unprofessional. The rooms vary in size and decoration. My room was comfortable despite cracking paint and water stains on the bathroom walls. My co-workers room was filled with plastic wicker furniture and a lamp that made the room a horrid shade of pink when lit. The rooms were clean in appearance though I found used silverware outside my door on two days of my stay (not left by myself) The bell staff at the Horton worked hard. They were always kind and did the best they could given the guest volume. I had to wait 15 minutes to get my car, that issue I fault management for and not the staff, who were obviously doing the best they could. The final thing that is simply bizarre has to do with the elevators. In addition to the jerky and unnerving stopping and starting, the hotel created extremely odd window scenes for your "enjoyment" when going up to the rooms. Overall I would not choose to stay at the Grand Horton again. That being said if you were in a bind it is certainly not the worst property to bed down in.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and Frustrating”
Reviews.Author: QuisCustodiet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient for the Gaslamp Quarter and the convention center. The prices aren't too bad either - although far from the cheapest available. However, the hotel is fairly tired in general and my room was worn and shabby in many ways; it all felt rather down at heel. Like another guest I also had a showerhead at the 5 feet mark, which is just infuriating. In addition the 'quaint period Victorian decor' is rather overpowering. I think the Frommers guide refers to it as "brothel"-inspired and they're not wrong. Finally, the hotel has a wireless internet service (at an extra $10 a day...) that wouldn't work in conjunction with my corporate VPN. The answer - customer service can help you reconfigure your IP (who on earth should have to do that?!) except that they're only available by email! Not acceptable in the 21st century.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly,convenient, and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Tulafaye
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Horton and had chosen it to be right in the gaslamp quarter. The staff was friendly and the location was great....but : Hotels.com had billed us $155/night for the room. Then we found out the Horton charges for everything : $24 /day for parking, $10/day for internet, $15/day per person for breakfast, $0.75 per phone call. In reality it cost over $200/night for my wife and I. We were surprised at the tiny room (clean) with a TV but no refrigerator. We were prepared to pay up to $300/night for a nice room, but what turned us off was thinking we would pay $155, and then getting a not-very-nice-room in a place where you wondered what they'd charge you for next...maybe use of the elevator ?

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but has quirks”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quaint with period (early 1900s) decor and antique furniture. It is in a great location near the convention center and in the gaslamp neighborhood. The hotel does have some idiosyncracies, though. First, the shower head is quite low (it was at my chin and I'm just 5'11"), which is just a small annoyance. There is no pool or fitness facility, nor do they offer lunch or dinner. They do have breakfast, and apps for dinner, but for a meal you'll need to go elsewhere. The storage for your clothes is inadequate as the furniture is antique. Nice rooms - very cool - but made for people with just a few garments. Another annoyance is that while the rooms do have irons they only have dormitory sized ironing boards. These are the ones that are about 2.5 feet long and you need to put on a table. This is not good for the business traveler that needs to iron all his/her shirts and pants. Again, it's a nice, period hotel, but it could use some simple upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: bobbyfett
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2007. Quaint hotel, lovely decor, great location: close to many attractions. We were very disappointed with the rude and unhelpful staff. When we arrived, the bellhop took our car for valet and did not help us with removing our luggage from the car, nor did he say "thank you" or "your welcome. This guy wouldn't even look us in the eye! We were hoping this rudeness would be it, however, there were more rude staff to come. Several staff working the front desk would only give short and brief answers to our questions. During our entire 3 day stay, we felt like we were more of a bother than a guest. I caught what appeared to be a manager on the phone while standing at the front desk and she was swearing at someone on the other end. Normally, they have a restaurant that serves breakfast but it was closed while we were there. Staff did not apologize for this and acted as if we were a bother to want a decent breakfast. Overall, great historic hotel but don't expect the staff to act like they like you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: KittyPG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Grand Horton for two nights in April. We loved San Diego and really enjoyed our stay at the Horton. The location was fantastic, within walking distance of everything. The hotel has a lot of history which the receptionist filled us in on when we arrived. Our room was perfectly clean (I have a big thing about cleanliness), lovely bathroom and we loved the fire in the room. The reception staff were very helpful - our luggage was lost by Delta for a day and they helped us get the luggage to the hotel. They also helped us with car rental and any taxi bookings required. We found the value excellent and if we return to San Diego we will be returning to the Horton Grand. I also recommend "The Field" for breakfast - just around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JMatheson
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the charming appearance as noted on their website. Room had been booked about 2 mos in advance yet when checking in, they were unable to honor our room request even though the hotel did not seem to be busy. The woman who checked us in was rude and acted like I was bothering her which left me with a very bad 1st impression. She actually told me that the head of housekeeping was complaining about having to check on what rooms were available. The rest of the staff seemed decent. Room was quite small but quaint. Could have been cleaner. The shower head was designed for very short people. I'm 5'5" and the shower was at shoulder level. They make a big deal about their award winning restaurant but it only serves breakfast. Some coffee in the lobby would be a nice touch as we had to walk several blocks to get morning coffee. Lots of noise at night from the street - mostly what sounded like drunk partyers. Overall, was disappointed. Had been looking forward to a nice hotel experience but was mediocre at best. Suggest they find a replacement for the woman at the front desk that checked us in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice but needs a little freshening”
Reviews.Author: acctprof
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Horton Grand March 15-16, 2007. The hotel is nicely appointed but is starting to show some wearniess in the period decor - a little dusty here, a light bulb out there. The location is right in the Gaslamp district so if you like quiet, ask for a roomoff the street. There is no internet access so leave your e-mail behind. There are no amenities like a pool, etc. but the basic hotel and breakfast (the hotel restaurant does not serve dinner as they recognize the futility of doing so in the Gaslamp) do the job quite well. Fairly good rates are available but tack on $24 per day for valet parking as there is no other self parking available. Short walking distance to convention center and downtown trolley. Staff (though minimal) are courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: pbmkot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for both business and pleasure, and it's certainly the perfect location for both. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the restaurant was very pretty (with good breakfasts!), and I really enjoyed all the historic mementoes. The entire hotel is extremely charming, even serving tea in a delightful little room off the lobby. The regular rooms are really quite small, so if you are staying there with more than one person, or for more than a couple nights, I would suggest you book a suite. It was also very convenient to have a coffeemaker, microwave and small fridge at our disposal. If you do reserve a regular room, make sure to ask for one with a normal-size armoire or closet! The room we had initially only had a short, narrow one, barely enough room for even one person's clothes! The desk clerk very graciously moved us to a suite when we asked if one was available. All the rooms we saw were decorated very charmingly, though. Not like your typical hotel room. Both my husband and I agree that we would stay at the Horton Grand again next time we're in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: msglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for one night back in August 2006 for a quick getaway. The hotel has a cozy feel to it. Our room was a decent size with a Victorian decor and its own fireplace, which was a pleasant surprise! It's also convenient to the Gaslamp Quarter; we didn't even need to take our car anywhere! We had no problems with noise either; the hotel was around the corner from the main hustle and bustle of the Gaslamp Quarter. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for Convention”
Reviews.Author: ClubMedTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Horton Grand during a trade show at the convention center. Close, did not have to walk far. Lots of shops and restaurants in area. This Hotel is clean, comfortable, and has a helpful, friendly staff. Wireless Internet access is $10/day, but if you are computer savvy, you can get on the free San Diego Net. Comedy club is just across alley and can create some noise late at night. Thin windows and walls between adjoining rooms was an issue. Ida Bailey's restaurant on property was very short staffed for breakfast, although food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Phobot
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at this hotel on Expedia as we were exhibiting at a convention and it was ideally located. The rooms were "okay". Nothing terrible, nothing spectacular. The hotel has history and character. However, the staff were so snotty and incompetent that I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. The restaurant was always closed and there was no room service. Due to this, one of us ordered a pizza and the staff refused to let the delivery person into the building. They called the room and stated "We don't allow delivery people into our hotel.". We had to go down and pick up the pizza outside of the front entrance to the hotel. The ceiling in one of the rooms started leaking water directly onto the bed. The solution to this problem was for the staff to come up and move the bed aside as the water continued to drip onto the floor instead. We had used the valet service but did not feel like getting the car out as we did not want to risk losing the parking space. We politely asked the valet to get us a cab, to which he rudely responded, "I don't hail cabs.". We decided to have him retrieve the car and when he returned he waited impatiently for us to tip him (which we did not!). About four of us sat in the courtyard one night playing a board game. We were laughing and having a good time but not being too noisy. However, a member of staff told us to be quiet so we decided to stop playing the game and just relax and talk. Another group came out to the courtyard and I guess they were too noisy because the same guy came back and yelled at us (a group of 30 year olds, mind you). He told us we all had to leave and we motioned over to the other group and he kicked them out as well. He went as far as turning off the lights strung about the courtyard. Our key cards never worked, we'd use them once and then have to get new ones. The rooms were booked in my husband's name and so even though we would present our key cards, they wouldn't give us new ones if our names weren't on the reservation. They even did this to members of our party that they had personally checked into the room. My husband had to call each time, until we finally suggested they write down the names of every person in our party. They did this begrudgingly and then acted as though they had done us a special favor... Basically, the staff treats people as uninvited house guests that are imposing upon them by staying at their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Charming”
Reviews.Author: kharm
Reviews.Content: We (4 girls )drove into the Gaslamp Quarter in San Diego on a last minute 26th birthday trip. We had checked other hotels such as the Days Inn and La Quinta which were just outside of the Gaslamp area, we got quoted about 180 from them. We figured for those prices we might as well stay in the area since we would be partying there. I had never heard of the hotel but it looked nice and cozy. We walked in and asked for their rates and if they had vacancy. We got a great deal on a room which was cheaper than the other places! The place is decorated Victorian style and the lobby was large and off to the side was a room with antiques and old photos of the hotels history. All the furniture in the rooms and halls appeared to be antique and old, but added to its charm! Our room had 2 beds a small bath, air conditioning, a fireplace, TV with cable, and 2 windows overlooking a small street of shops. It was clean and warm which is all we asked for! I would book this place if you appreciate a place with a little more character and history. True it doesn't have all the fancy and modern things as other places in the area but the vibe and friendliness of the staff made it worth it. Both times I asked for something at the front desk the staff was very helpful and friendly. I read on some other reviews about there being too much noise but we stayed on the 3rd floor and didnt hear a thing, even with a club right on the corner half a block up.

Reviews.Title: “In a word, disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: x2345
Reviews.Content: The Victorian decor was nice, but the total experience was unpleasant. The hotel is in the Gas Lamp District -- the noise at night from the courtyard and street was too much. The non-smoking rooms were definitely smelly. The front desk was helpful and pleasant, but we were plagued with extremely slow service in the restaurant. Wireless internet for additional $10 day. It certainly was not worth the expense. I will not return. There are plenty of other better places to stay in downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “What a comfortable value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently had the opportunity to stay at the Horton Grand for four nights and wish it had been longer. Late registration for a convention found all of the "chrome palaces" full and a referral sent me to the Horton Grand. Starting with the walk in the door and registration, the entire stay was absolutely great. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable, the hotel staff was way above what I had experienced earlier in the year at a "chrome palace" across the "tracks". It was so close to the convention center that I did not even have to take the shuttle yet far enough away to avoid the noise and traffic. The staff (including the general manager) went way overboard to make sure that any questions were answered and provided great referrals for meals in the area. For the $$$$$, you could not beat this place and I plan to bring my wife back for a personal stay. On a value basis "10 point scale", this would be an "11". The thing that really topped it off was the hummingbird that hovered next to me while sitting on the little patio off of my room while in the middle of downtown/Gaslamp district San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Experience”
Reviews.Author: almondbark
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of setting up our annual conference. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Any concerns I may have had were dealt with immediately and efficently. The food was excellent. Parking was a problem due to streets being closed for the Fat Tuesday Block Party. Being in the Gas Lamp district provided all of our attendees plenty of choices for dinner. Everyone agreed it was one of the best conferences we have had in years. Thank You to the entire staff for making our San Diego experience one to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Clean, Attached Pictures”
Reviews.Author: JessNRaleigh
Reviews.Content: I just visited San Diego for a conference at the San Diego Conference Center. The Horton Grand was the only hotel I could afford within walking distance from the conference center. The other hotels were considerably higher in price. I would say the best thing about this hotel is it's location in the Gaslamp District. The room was clean and charming. I felt like I was staying in an old victorian home. This hotel was built in the late 1800's, so I wasn't surprised that I could hear noise from the outside. Although, I thought it was neat being in the middle of the Gaslamp District. Overall, I was satisfied with my stay. Although, I am sure there are nicer hotels in the area for a higher price. See attached pics if you'd like.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for the first time in August, 2005. We were impressed by the quaintness and charm of The Horton Grand. Our room was very nice. We would have liked to have seen a larger bathroom mirror; it was also placed rather high - I had to stand on the phone book and I am 5' 4" tall! Also, some of the remarks left by guests in the room's guestbook were rather profane. I was surprised they were left there for others to see. It does get noisy on weekend nights, but that is the chance one takes when staying in the heart of the Gaslamp District. We were surprised, however, to hear so much noise early on a Sunday morning (construction traffic - on a Sunday, no less). Other than those minor things, the stay was very nice.
